div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2089 S. Caterina Villarmosa, 10 km. N of Caltanissetta, 1955 Burial: c. 420 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: c. 100 AR. Pot hoard Rhegium: 2 tetradr. (1 mule-car; 1 oecist) Acragas: 7 didr. Catana Gela: 2 (3?) tetradr. (to Jenkins 399 and 483?) 5 didr. Himera: 1 didr. Leontini: 2 tetradr. (to c. 424 B.C.) 2 didr. Messana: 3 Naxus: 1 didr. (Cahn Grp. V) Segesta: 4 didr. Selinus Syracuse: 13 (to Boehringer Grp. XXII or XXIII) Athens: 7 (5th cent.) Disposition: Agrigento 55 as above plus a number of probable intrusions Griffo, AIIN 1955, pp. 199-200 Jenkins, Gela, p. 157 Jenkins interprets this as a hd. of c. 420 B.C., with intrusions (incl. Gela, no. 483, two 4th cent. Athens, and some modern forgeries)
